bio:
Ye Lu is a Language Lecturer at NYU Shanghai. Prior to joining NYU Shanghai, she worked as a Chinese teacher for the University of Virginia’s Shanghai Summer program in 2013, Council on International Educational Exchange, the Alliance for Global Education. She also worked as an adjunct Chinese Instructor in NYU Shanghai. She holds a MA degree in Teaching Chinese to Speakers of other Languages from East China Normal University.

Research Interests

  • Chinese characters
  • Chinese grammar
  • Second language teaching pedagogy

Courses Taught

  • Elementary Chinese I
  • Elementary Chinese II
  • Elementary Chinese I for Advanced Beginners
  • Intermediate Chinese I

Education

  • MA, Teaching Chinese to Speakers of other Languages, East China Normal University, 2015
  • BA, Teaching Chinese to Speakers of other Languages, Shanghai University, 2012

Languages

Chinese, English
